blog.title: Whack yo
blog.description: fuckin',,,, gay

summary: The only reason my suicidal ass is alive right now is because I’m waiting to see whats happening to Tony in A4.  Looking back...
body:
The only reason my suicidal ass is alive right now is because I’m waiting to see whats happening to Tony in A4. 

Looking back his deepest darkest fear was the avengers dying.

But after everything that’s happened, his new found family and friends. Everyone’s gone…. Except for the original avengers. 

Like,,, If somebody who didn’t waste their creative talent on septiplier fanfiction when they were 11 was willing to write something….. I would be your bitch.

Looking back his deepest darkest fear was the avengers dying.

Like,,, If somebody who didn’t waste their creative talent on septiplier fanfiction when they were 11 was willing to write something….. I would be your bitch.

blog.title: Ao3-Feed: Tony Stark
blog.description: This blog is an automated list of the stories posted on Archive Of Our Own under the Tony Stark tag. The stories are automatically posted here from the AO3 RSS feed.

summary: Can't Help Falling in Love With You
title: Can't Help Falling in Love With You
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2PJzYzR

by knarcelestial

Wade takes a step forward and sees multiple pairs of eyes flash up, vigilant, waiting patiently like starving hyenas trying to devour Bambi when he least expects it. Wade glances over at Peter and sees his face stuffed deeper into his book than all of these Alphas’ egos are shoved up their asses. Right. Leaving to go order right now doesn’t seem like the smartest thing to do. Wade kindly sits back down in his seat.

Or, five times Wade Wilson was jealous and the one time he acted on it (and scored himself a happy ending).

Words: 4895, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

blog.title: Ao3-Feed: Tony Stark
blog.description: This blog is an automated list of the stories posted on Archive Of Our Own under the Tony Stark tag. The stories are automatically posted here from the AO3 RSS feed.

summary: Mr Stark Enough For You? (another field trip fic bcs we dont have enough)
title: Mr Stark Enough For You? (another field trip fic bcs we dont have enough)
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2Aj3tTD

by Livinei

Peter isn’t worried because he thinks Tony won’t say yes, he’s worried because he’s sure Tony will. And he’s not sure how he feels about having his entire class waltzing around the place where he spends practically more time than in his own home, where he has his own room, and where he regularly eats Lucky Charms with one of the most influential men in the country, in his pajamas. Not that they’d ever know any of that. Tour groups don’t go to the living quarters of the Tower anyways, they hardly ever go past the 50th floor, Peter knows that. And it isn’t fair to his class if he doesn’t ask just because he…spends a lot of time there?
Yeah, Peter sighs, he has to ask. He promised, anyways.

IT’S A FIELD TRIP FIC, WE LOVE THOSE

Words: 7054, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Spider-Man: Homecoming (2017)
  • Rating: Not Rated
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply

blog.name: iron--spider
blog.title: speaking of loyalty
blog.description:
allie

iron_spider on Ao3

This blog is anti-starker. Iron Dad only.

I’ve got a kofi at ko-fi.com/ironspider if you enjoy my work that much! :)

tags: i cannot believe this is done
it's been with me for so long
let me know what you think
summary: what if there is no tomorrow? (chapter three, conclusion) by iron_spider “What if there is no tomorrow?” Tony asks. He shakes...
caption:
what if there is no tomorrow? (chapter three, conclusion) by iron_spider

“What if there is no tomorrow?” Tony asks. He shakes his head, and he hates that this conversation isn’t happening face to face, so he pulls up the faceplate. Peter straightens up. “I mean—what if tomorrow isn’t today? What if this is the last damn loop and we fuck up your legs? Or, God forbid something—something else—” He clenches his hands in the suit, listens to the mechanical clicks. This is why he couldn’t pick who he was gonna try to get out first—it couldn’t be Pepper because she’s pregnant, because if he dropped her again—again—he wouldn’t be able to live with it. And Peter, Happy and Rhodey—he loves them so much he doesn’t know what to do when he thinks too hard about it—that much love means that much more loss. But Peter—he’s responsible for Peter. He can’t let anything happen to Peter. He can’t deal with anything happening to Peter. He wants the loop to end, more than anything, but not if they make a fatal mistake.

“Boss, I suggest you take a deep breath, your heart rate is getting too high.”

“Tony, you’re the best,” Peter says, nodding at him. “You are, you—you’re the best. You’ve done so much for me, and I just—I don’t think—I know you’re not exactly feeling positive about this whole thing, I get it, especially after what you’ve told us, but I—I don’t know, I feel like we’re gonna get out. Intact, you know, not—not with broken necks or broken legs. Even if this particular thing doesn’t work, I think…I think we’re gonna make it out.”

“What makes you think that?” Tony asks, his voice shaking, and he hates that he’s the adult here and he sounds like a little kid.

“I can’t really put my finger on it,” Peter says. “I just…have a feeling.”

Tony trusts Peter, almost always, almost as much as Peter trusts him. The kid has a good heart and good instincts, and maybe it’s the hopefulness in his head that’s making Tony think of the future. Of a way out.

“Okay,” Tony says, nodding, closing the faceplate again. The screen lights up, and Tony sees Peter nodding back. “Hold onto me, and I’ll let you know if we’re going down. But you’re a smart kid—you’ll probably know.”

“I can’t really put my finger on it,” Peter says. “I just…have a feeling.”

Tony trusts Peter, almost always, almost as much as Peter trusts him. The kid has a good heart and good instincts, and maybe it’s the hopefulness in his head that’s making Tony think of the future. Of a way out.

“Okay,” Tony says, nodding, closing the faceplate again. The screen lights up, and Tony sees Peter nodding back. “Hold onto me, and I’ll let you know if we’re going down. But you’re a smart kid—you’ll probably know.”

trail.content_raw:
what if there is no tomorrow? (chapter three, conclusion) by iron_spider

“What if there is no tomorrow?” Tony asks. He shakes his head, and he hates that this conversation isn’t happening face to face, so he pulls up the faceplate. Peter straightens up. “I mean—what if tomorrow isn’t today? What if this is the last damn loop and we fuck up your legs? Or, God forbid something—something else—” He clenches his hands in the suit, listens to the mechanical clicks. This is why he couldn’t pick who he was gonna try to get out first—it couldn’t be Pepper because she’s pregnant, because if he dropped her again—again—he wouldn’t be able to live with it. And Peter, Happy and Rhodey—he loves them so much he doesn’t know what to do when he thinks too hard about it—that much love means that much more loss. But Peter—he’s responsible for Peter. He can’t let anything happen to Peter. He can’t deal with anything happening to Peter. He wants the loop to end, more than anything, but not if they make a fatal mistake.

“Boss, I suggest you take a deep breath, your heart rate is getting too high.”

“Tony, you’re the best,” Peter says, nodding at him. “You are, you—you’re the best. You’ve done so much for me, and I just—I don’t think—I know you’re not exactly feeling positive about this whole thing, I get it, especially after what you’ve told us, but I—I don’t know, I feel like we’re gonna get out. Intact, you know, not—not with broken necks or broken legs. Even if this particular thing doesn’t work, I think…I think we’re gonna make it out.”

“What makes you think that?” Tony asks, his voice shaking, and he hates that he’s the adult here and he sounds like a little kid.

“I can’t really put my finger on it,” Peter says. “I just…have a feeling.”

Tony trusts Peter, almost always, almost as much as Peter trusts him. The kid has a good heart and good instincts, and maybe it’s the hopefulness in his head that’s making Tony think of the future. Of a way out.

“Okay,” Tony says, nodding, closing the faceplate again. The screen lights up, and Tony sees Peter nodding back. “Hold onto me, and I’ll let you know if we’re going down. But you’re a smart kid—you’ll probably know.”
trail.content:
what if there is no tomorrow? (chapter three, conclusion) by iron_spider

“What if there is no tomorrow?” Tony asks. He shakes his head, and he hates that this conversation isn’t happening face to face, so he pulls up the faceplate. Peter straightens up. “I mean—what if tomorrow isn’t today? What if this is the last damn loop and we fuck up your legs? Or, God forbid something—something else—” He clenches his hands in the suit, listens to the mechanical clicks. This is why he couldn’t pick who he was gonna try to get out first—it couldn’t be Pepper because she’s pregnant, because if he dropped her again—again—he wouldn’t be able to live with it. And Peter, Happy and Rhodey—he loves them so much he doesn’t know what to do when he thinks too hard about it—that much love means that much more loss. But Peter—he’s responsible for Peter. He can’t let anything happen to Peter. He can’t deal with anything happening to Peter. He wants the loop to end, more than anything, but not if they make a fatal mistake.

“Boss, I suggest you take a deep breath, your heart rate is getting too high.”

“Tony, you’re the best,” Peter says, nodding at him. “You are, you—you’re the best. You’ve done so much for me, and I just—I don’t think—I know you’re not exactly feeling positive about this whole thing, I get it, especially after what you’ve told us, but I—I don’t know, I feel like we’re gonna get out. Intact, you know, not—not with broken necks or broken legs. Even if this particular thing doesn’t work, I think…I think we’re gonna make it out.”

“What makes you think that?” Tony asks, his voice shaking, and he hates that he’s the adult here and he sounds like a little kid.

“I can’t really put my finger on it,” Peter says. “I just…have a feeling.”

Tony trusts Peter, almost always, almost as much as Peter trusts him. The kid has a good heart and good instincts, and maybe it’s the hopefulness in his head that’s making Tony think of the future. Of a way out.

“Okay,” Tony says, nodding, closing the faceplate again. The screen lights up, and Tony sees Peter nodding back. “Hold onto me, and I’ll let you know if we’re going down. But you’re a smart kid—you’ll probably know.”

blog.name: loki-the-fox
blog.title: Hey
blog.description: My name is River, 26, bi/ace, female, Libra, INFP, 💛Hufflepuff🖤 [MASTERLIST]

summary: I used to be an anti before I knew Tony’s backstory, but now I relate to him so much. Like he uses humor and sarcasm as a coping...
question: I used to be an anti before I knew Tony’s backstory, but now I relate to him so much. Like he uses humor and sarcasm as a coping mechanism and deals with so much shit that he never lets anyone see and- I’m ranting but. He now has my love and appreciation. Send Ask.
answer: I relate to him in a lot of ways too! I’m actually sad that I can’t watch Iron Man 3 without feeling uncomfortable because of his anxiety attack. I loved Iron Man 3! It’s just the acting is so good and RDJ is so talented that it looks so real and it makes me feel like I’m going to have one too. I dunno if that’s weird or if anyone else has that experience. I just really love Tony and I wish I could tell him how much I appreciate him!

reblog.comment: I relate to him in a lot of ways too! I’m actually sad that I can’t watch Iron Man 3 without feeling uncomfortable because of his anxiety attack. I loved Iron Man 3! It’s just the acting is so good and RDJ is so talented that it looks so real and it makes me feel like I’m going to have one too. I dunno if that’s weird or if anyone else has that experience. I just really love Tony and I wish I could tell him how much I appreciate him!

blog.name: marvelzombiesrp
blog.title: Marvel Zombies RP
blog.description:
Mobile Navigation

Halloween, 2016. The outbreak was rampant before it was even detected. Police reports about "zombies" were taken for pranks, overly exuberant teenage performance art. Who could ever have guessed that it was the work of a D-list villain of the super scientist variety, escaped from a lab in a warehouse by the docks, and rapidly infecting everything they could bite.

The infection moved quickly, sweeping across America, and superheroes, so concerned with the preservation of life, learned too late that lethal measures were the only tool they had to protect the uninfected from the hungry hoard. A group of heroes and what survivors they could gather retreated to Avengers Tower, but it was always going to be a temporary measure . . .

summary: My personal intro into the comicverse
body:
My personal intro into the comicverse

I finally given up on my attempt to not read comics but I am not quite sure where to dive in. Right now I am looking at Captian America and/or Iron Man. Holy shit I am beginning to feel overwhelmed already…
